column5: Which of the following is a better summarisation of this ontology?

column6: none of them are really good
Property in between business product and product offering should include some line breaks since it crosses the arrows of the rest of the properties and difficults reading.
Above all the summarization F is the most complete since represents classes with object properties, however, I still find this representation a bit incomplete.

Having floating classes does not help understand what the ontology does, in my opinion. The F representation helps more than the others, but has a repeated edge and has floating classes with no clear relationship to the rest of the model. Had the duplicated edges been removed I would have raised my score. Had the floating classes been related to the rest, I would have raised my score
Even though I think L is the best, there is one class ''floating'' that does not seem connected to the rest of the diagram (Resource Group)
M seems to lack concepts in its summarization. F is very unclear with hash ids, and  L has more information on the concepts, the role of Concept and Concept Scheme in the summarization is not clear.
F is clear in the names of its terms, representing the main entities and relationships. L has a couple of isolated classes, specially the role of the class Datatype is not clear

The summarization L is the most complete above all, since it represents all the classes and almost all the object properties. However, I don't understand the box called "Datatype" in that representation.
Presents in a disorganized way (same term in different languages), entities and relationships.

Although for me the best summarisation is the F, because it also represents some object property, this one is also a bit difficult to understand. Maybe there is needed to represent also the subclasses.

All the serializations mix labels in multiple languages, which is inconsistent. Those labels are correct in both languages in the ontology. F at least captures relationships, but there are floating relationships
